title: Esa results
content: How can I calculate how much I got in esa

comments.body:
You know your grade, let's assume this to be A for now. Which means you know that you got *at least* the lower bound and *not more* than the upper bound for this grade. In our example, this translates to 80-89. Let's assume you got an 89 overall score. 

You know your ISA scores, assignment/lab/project scores as well. Plug it into the overall formula (ISA + ESA + miscellaneous = 89) and you should get your ESA score.

Thank you but
Will they officially display??
If we apply for re-evaluation, will we be able to know our marks?
Apply for paper review. You'll get to know your marks. Re-eval will simply give you your new grade (which may be same as your old one)
Can we apply for reval after reviewing the paper or we have to apply before viewing our answer script only?
You can review and then choose to apply for re-eval. This is the standard process everyone follows.

[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PAwDRIW3l559vBo-kW3oIUrKhm4dPOMl9a12uEFp6Nc/edit?gid=1838505542#gid=1838505542](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PAwDRIW3l559vBo-kW3oIUrKhm4dPOMl9a12uEFp6Nc/edit?gid=1838505542#gid=1838505542) You can use this to calculate the min marks you must have gotten for that grade and final isa.\[assuming no relative\]
How to apply for paper review?
